error.signature: Error: Target container is not a DOM element. (createPortal)
error.regex: Target container is not a DOM element|createPortal.*null|createPortal.*undefined|portal.*target.*not.*found

verdict.summary: ReactDOM.createPortal() called with a null or undefined DOM container. The target element does not exist in the DOM yet (timing issue) or the selector is wrong.

dead_ends.action: Use document.body as the portal target
dead_ends.why_fails: Appending directly to document.body can conflict with third-party scripts, modal libraries, and CSS stacking contexts. May break SSR where document is not available.

dead_ends.action: Create the DOM element dynamically inside the component render
dead_ends.why_fails: Creating DOM elements during render is a side effect; the element may be created multiple times in StrictMode and is not cleaned up properly

workarounds.action: Add a dedicated portal root element in index.html and use getElementById
workarounds.how:
In index.html:
. In component: createPortal(children, document.getElementById('portal-root'))

workarounds.action: Use useEffect to create and append the portal container, with cleanup to remove it
workarounds.how: const [container] = useState(() => document.createElement('div')); useEffect(() => { document.body.appendChild(container); return () => document.body.removeChild(container); }, [container]); return container ? createPortal(children, container) : null;
workarounds.condition: When a static HTML element is not available (e.g., in a library)

leads_to.condition: When portal target exists on client but not during SSR, causing hydration mismatch

preceded_by.condition: When the portal error is uncaught and the developer adds an Error Boundary that then needs portal-like rendering for its fallback

frequently_confused_with.distinction: portal-target-missing is about the DOM element argument to createPortal being null, while cannot-find-react-dom-client is an import/module resolution error for the react-dom/client package
